data.question: What is the name of the new zeolitic-imidazolate framework reported?
What is the synthesis yield of COK-17 based on Zn?
At what temperature and pressure does COK-17 transition from open-pore to closed-pore phase at 50 K?
data.answer: 106 MPa for OP-to-CP transition and -62 MPa for CP-to-OP transition

data.question: What is the role of chlorine substituents in COK-17 according to the text?
data.answer: Chlorine substituents mediate the adsorption of CO2 by London dispersion forces.

data.question: Is the adsorption energy for CO2 higher in COK-17 or ZIF-8?
Is the adsorption capacity of COK-17 for CO2 higher than for CH4?
What is the main advantage of COK-17 over other adsorbents for CO2 capture?
data.answer: COK-17 has exceptionally high affinity for the adsorption of CO2 compared to other adsorbents such as ZIF-8 and ZIF-71.

data.question: What method was used to investigate the flexibility of COK-17?
data.answer: Force field simulations were used to investigate the flexibility of COK-17.

data.question: Is the selectivity of COK-17 for CO2 over CH4 affected by the CO2/CH4 mixture composition?
What computational method was used to calculate adsorption energies for CO2 and CH4 in COK-17?
data.answer: Periodic Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations were used.

data.question: Does the presence of Cl substituents in COK-17 increase the van der Waals interactions for CO2 adsorption?
What is the effect of temperature on the structural flexibility of COK-17?
data.answer: The structural flexibility of COK-17 varies with temperature, showing different (meta)stable phases and transition temperatures.
